bibl.title: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1947

div1.p: Wyllie requests permission to borrow Reed materials from Hench for an exhibit at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, October 24, 1947
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
24 October 1947
DIVISION OF RARE BOOKS
AND
MANUSCRIPTS
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
The splendid news that you are to speak here on the
17th of November leads me to ask you something that has been
in my mind for some time. Would you be willing to lend us
some of the treasures of the Hench-Reed Collection for exhibi-
tion during the month of November? We have three large cases
in the main hallway of this building, four in the Documents
Room, five in the Rare Book Room and two in the Medical Library
--all of which we would be very happy to turn over to a Walter
Reed Exhibit. Our own material, which you know from recent
examination, will fill only a few cases, and even though your
own treasures will throw these completely in the shade, I would
be particularly pleased if we could put on a Walter Reed Exhibit
here of the sort that would be possible only through the use of
the materials you yourself have.

I can give you the details of our insurance policies
for loans on exhibits in case you are interested in them. We
have complete coverage for such things at the appraised evalu-
ation of the owner. Our facilities for showing, location and
size of cases and so on you are sufficiently familiar with
yourself, so that I need not comment on them.

Although this is asking a good deal, I do hope that
you will see fit to let us have some of the great items in the
Walter Reed Collection for showing.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, John Cook Wyllie
Curator of Rare Books Dr. Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
